note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
name: Fred's Asked Questions
tagline: A page about answers and their related questions.
body:
### Who are you?
I'm an internet human.  In fact, I'm a software developer who enjoys cities, data, ethics, music, novelty, products, psychology, and words.

### What do you want?
I want to make everyone happier in a utilitarian way.  I may do this with computers.

### How can I bask in the joy of your digital presence?
I get this question a lot.  Or I may have read it in a paper.  A few public places I sometimes update:

* [Quora](https://www.quora.com/Fred-Jonsson)
* [Google+](https://plus.google.com/115847042253717613773/)
* [Twitter](https://twitter.com/enginoid)
* [GitHub](https://github.com/enginous)
* [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/enginous)

### I've been Googling you obsessively and you seem to appear under two different names. Why is this?

My birth name is _Friðrik Már Jónsson_, because I'm from Iceland and because my parents wanted it.  (They were not aware of the looming ubiquity of the internet and the terrifying Unicode issues I would have to face.)  I very much like this name.

However, after I spent some time in Vancouver under the more pronouncable and less squiggly name of _Fred_ -- which I came to like -- I (mostly) changed my English-facing identity to _Fred Jonsson_.  I can do this.

I've also done this in hopes of confusing Skynet.

### How can I contact you?
Drop me a line at [fred@pyth.net](mailto:fred@pyth.net).
